abstract: MacArthur Foundation closes its Russian offices after discovering lawmakers there placed them on preliminary list of nongovernmental groups that may be illegal under May 2015 legislation; nonprofit has been in Russia since 1992 and has granted over $173 million for projects in country.
lead_paragraph: After more than 20 years of grant-making in Russia, the foundation decided to close after the government included it on a list of groups deemed “undesirable.”

headline.main: MacArthur Foundation to Close Offices in Russia
headline.print_headline: Put on Blacklist, U.S. Foundation Decides to Close Offices in Russia

snippet: After more than 20 years of grant-making in Russia, the foundation decided to close after the government included it on a list of groups deemed “undesirable.”

keywords.value: MacArthur, John D and Catherine T, Foundation
keywords.name: organizations
